commitResults.messageTitle: Duke.java: Requirements of Level-1 added in. - added in chatbot personality "Berry" - added in the function of repeating back the command given to it. - added in the function of handling "bye" command and other commands.
Duke.java: modified repeat function to become addText.
Duke.java: added functionality to store and list tasks, completing Level-2 requirements.
Duke.java: Requirements of Level-3 added in. - added in Task and TaskBook class.
Duke.java: fixed bugs and added in javadocs with comments.
Duke.java: changed access modifiers and function names.
Duke.java: fixed some naming conventions and cleaned code.
Duke.java: added in support for child classes for Tasks (Todo, Deadline, Event).
Duke.java: bug fixes, can handle common Task input.
Duke.java: minor grammar fixes.
automated testing input.txt and EXPECTED.txt updated
Duke.java: added in skeleton for DukeException class.
Duke.java: added exception handling for out of range inputs, missing inputs, and unreadable commands.
Duke.java: bug fixes and and added deleteTask function.
Duke.java: updated javadocs
Duke.java: added enum TaskType to indicate task types.
Updated input.txt and EXPECTED.txt for automated testing.
Separate Duke.java into Duke.java, Deadline.java, Task.java, TaskType.java, Todo.java, Event.java
commitResults.messageBody:
There were several classes in Duke.java which made it hard to read and debug.

Separating them into their own java class files improves code readability.

Let's create new java files for their respective new classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Separate DukeException.java into EmptyDescriptionException.java, IndexOutOfRangeException.java, MissingClauseException.java and UnknownCommandException.java
commitResults.messageBody:
There were several types of exceptions to handle which is more clearly depicted by separate classes which inherit DukeException.

Separating them into their own java class exception files improves code readability.

Let's create new java exception files for their respective new classes.

commitResults.messageBody:
The variables in a class with no intended inheritance should be set to private to prevent unintended exposure of the subclass. There are also instances of inappropriate variable names to represent a plural object.

Improving the access modifier from protected to public, and representing the variables in their correct grammar form improves code quality.

This improves readability so that the code can be easily maintained and referred.

Let's,
* change the access modifiers of variables in classes with no child classes to private
* update variable names to better suit its object type - singular or plural, especially if there are any changes made to its implementations

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert feature into code
commitResults.messageBody:
There are several assumptions that have been made for the functionality of several methods. There should be a way to document the assumptions at various points in the code.

Assertions document the important assumptions made for readability.

Let's,
* add assert statements for relevant assumptions made for a method functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: Update variables names to comply with code quality
Update GUI
